name: Falafel
description: falafel, a staple Middle Eastern dish—and a popular street food around the world—that consists of fried spiced balls or patties of ground chickpeas or fava beans (or a mixture of both)

name: Beans
description: Baked beans is a dish traditionally containing white beans that are parboiled and then, in the US, baked in sauce at low temperature for a lengthy period.

name: Beans & Eggs
description: Eggs plus baked beans which is a dish traditionally containing white beans that are parboiled and then, in the US, baked in sauce at low temperature for a lengthy period.

name: Baba Ghanoug
description: baba ghanoush, also spelled baba ganoush or baba ganouj, relish with Middle Eastern origins that is made of eggplant (aubergine) blended with tahini, garlic, lemon juice, and salt.

name: Pasta Salad
description: Fresh and easy pasta salad packed with crisp vegetables, fresh mozzarella, and tossed with a simple homemade dressing. The perfect side dish!

name: Greek Salad
description: This easy Greek Salad is made with plum tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, bell pepper, kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese. Tossed with a lemon and red wine vinegar vinaigrette dressing.

name: Kale Soup
description: A nourishing soup of blended vegetables that would make a perfect supper along with a toasted baguette and cheese. Top with kale chips for a bit of added interest when serving.

name: Pumpkin Soup
description: Make this recipe in the fall when the small three-pound sugar pumpkins are stacked high in the produce aisle, bringing forth the bounty and flavors of the autumn—a time for warming soups and stews. As a fun garnish, top the soup with toasted pepitas and a swirl of sour cream, or toasted sourdough or rye croutons.

name: Carrot Ginger Soup
description: carrot and ginger + saucepan + oil and sauté the onions + garlic +

name: Carrot Potato Soup
description: Potatoes and carrots + saucepan + onion, garlic

name: Lentil Soup
description: Lentils  and potato  + carrots + saucepan + onion, garlic

name: Koshary
description: A traditional Egyptian staple, mixing pasta, rice and brown lentils, and topped with a zesty tomato sauce, garlic vinegar and garnished with chickpeas and crispy fried onions.

name: Shawarma
description: A large cone of pressed lamb or chicken that is rotated vertically in front of a flame grill

name: Alex-Kebda
description: The liver is prepared with hot pepper and garlic or onion can be added.As for the sausage

name: Fried Calamari
description: Squid, buttermilk.

name: Molokhya
description: A soup made from mallow leaves. Green in color, it has a thick, viscous texture.

name: Besarah
description: A creamy green puree prepared with parsley, dill, leek, ground beans, spices, green pepper and fried onions on top.

name: Pigeon
description: A traditional delicacy food, pigeons (Hamaam) are bred throughout Egypt in conical pigeon towers.

name: Mahshi
description: A baked vegetables, usually peppers, zucchini or aubergine, stuffed with rice mixed with aromatic herbs (parsley, coriander…).

name: Kofta
description: Flame-grilled chunks of lamb (kebab) and spiced minced meat made into a sausage and grilled on a skewer (kofta)

name: Hawawshii
description: A bread (something similar to pita bread) that is usually filled with minced meat, onion, pepper. Hawawshi is perhaps best known as a staple of home-style Egyptian cooking to make you feel good

name: Mix-Desserts
description: Mix od Basbosaa and Konafa in one plate

name: Basbosaa
description: A tasty dessert that has crossed borders, the Basbousa is of Ottoman origin. Found in different countries, it is favored by people all over the world.

name: Konafaa
description: The Kanefeh is a cake prepared with some semolina noodles, similar to angel hair, which are rolled and flattened and cooked together with butter and a creamy cheese over low heat. Once ready, it is soaked in syrup and a few groundnuts are added.

name: Om-Ali
description: Om-Ali is made of layers of puff pastry soaked in milk and mixed with nuts, raisins, coconut flakes, and sugar, and then baked.

name: Baklava
description: A cream base and a crunchy vermicelli pastry crust and Basbousa, made of semolina pastry soaked in honey and topped with hazelnuts.

name: Tea
description: Tea (Shai) is served strong and extremely sweet. For Western-style tea ask for “Shai Lipton”, made with a teabag.

name: Sugarcane Juice
description: Even more popular (it’s cheaper) than fruit juice is sugarcane juice (Asab). The cane is ground up and served as a milky green liquid.

name: Limoon Juice
description: A refreshing summer drink of squeezed lemon juice, water, and sugar, served with ice.

name: Sahlab
description: A winter drink made from the starch in the ground bulb of an orchid, mixed with milk, sugar, and rosewater, then garnished with chopped pistachios and cinnamon.

name: Karkade
description: A drink that can be served either hot or cold, made from the boiled, dried leaves of the hibiscus plant, with sugar added to taste.

name: Yansoon
description: Yansun is an aniseed-flavored drink, besides being consumed for its rich flavor, it is also recommended for colds and throat problems.
